content.description: Start standing and the climb the slab however you see fit. There are a few different possibilities on this wide slab.
content.protection: One pad is fine, though a pad is not necessary.
content.location: Located on the slabby west face of the boulder. This is the face that you will first see when approaching from the parking.

content.description: Start standing/crouching with some sloping angled crimps at 5 feet. Use small, polished feet to move upwards and gain the positive lip. Top out easily.
content.protection: One pad is fine, though a pad is not needed.
content.location: Located on the left side of the east face of the boulder. This is the red line on the topo photo.

content.description: Start sitting with hands on two small opposing crimps at 3 feet. A hard pull off the ground leads to a crimp sidepull and better holds above.
content.protection: One pad is fine, though a pad is not necessary.
content.location: Located in the middle of the east face of the boulder. The yellow line on the topo photo.

content.description: Start sitting with hands matched on a small incut edge on the arete on the right side of the face. Use terrible holds and great feet to move leftwards until reaching the end of the good foot ledge. From here, head straight up to better holds and an easy top out.
content.protection: One pad is fine, though a pad is not necessary.
content.location: Located on the right side of the east face of the boulder. The blue line in the topo photo.

content.description: This small area is located less than a mile east of Edwards Avenue and can also be accessed from that parking. However, if you access it from Woodcliff Beach, it's a much shorter hike. There is one boulder here with around 3-5 lines, depending on your level of creativity. While the boulder is short, it does offer another opportunity to climb for area locals and the short approach makes visiting for a short session a breeze.
